head.title: World Briefing | Americas: Ecuador: President's Supporters Try To Storm Congress

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Americas: Ecuador: President's Supporters Try To Storm Congress

abstract.p: Supporters of Pres Rafael Correa of Ecuador attempt to storm Congress to protest lawmakers' efforts to raise their own salaries and to show support for plan by Correa to convene assembly to rewrite parts of Constitution (S)

block.p: Hundreds of protesters tried to storm Congress, forcing violent clashes with the police. The protesters, largely supporters of President Rafael Correa, a leftist economist, had gathered to criticize an effort by lawmakers to raise their own salaries and to show support for a plan by Mr. Correa to convene an assembly to rewrite parts of the Constitution. Tensions have been building between Mr. Correa and Congress.
